intersectionLine2D(p_oPointA : flash.geom.Point, p_oPointB : flash.geom.Point, p_oPointC : flash.geom.Point, p_oPointD : flash.geom.Point) : flash.geom.Point

Computation of the intersection point between 2 2D lines AB and CD. This function returns the intersection point. Returns null in case the two lines are coincident or parallel Original implementation : http://local.wasp.uwa.edu.au/~pbourke/geometry/lineline2d/

intersectionLine3D(p_oPointA : sandy.core.data.Point3D, p_oPointB : sandy.core.data.Point3D, p_oPointC : sandy.core.data.Point3D, p_oPointD : sandy.core.data.Point3D) : Array<sandy.core.data.Point3D>

parameters:
p_oPointA A Point3D of the first 3D line.
p_oPointB Another Point3D of the first 3D line.
p_oPointC A Point3D of the second 3D line.
p_oPointD Another Point3D of the second 3D line.
returns:
An array containing the Point3Ds of the segment connecting the two 3D lines.
Computes the smallest distance between two 3D lines.

As 3D lines cannot intersect, we compute two points, first owning to the first 3D line, and the second point owning to the second 3D line.

The two points define a segment which length represents the shortest distance between these two lines.
